questions.question_text: Which two are prerequisites for setting up Flashback Data Archive?

discussion.content: Use the CREATE FLASHBACK ARCHIVE statement to create a flashback data archive, which provides the ability to automatically track and archive transactional data changes to specified database objects. A flashback data archive consists of multiple tablespaces and stores historic data from all transactions against tracked tables. The data is stored in internal history tables.

choices.A: Fast Recovery Area should be defined.
choices.B: Undo retention guarantee should be enabled.
choices.F: The tablespace in which the Flashback Data Archive is created should have Automatic Segment Space Management (ASSM) enabled.
choices.E: All users using Flashback Data Archive should have unlimited quota on the Flashback Data Archive tablespace.
choices.D: Automatic Undo Management should be enabled.

questions.question_text:
Examine the command:
$expdp SYSTEM FULL=YES DUMPFILE=dpump_dir1:fulll%U.dmp, dpump_dir2:full2% U.dmp, dpump_dir3:full3%U.djnp FILESIZE=400M PARALLEL=3

JOB_NAME=expfull -
Which statement is true about the execution of the command?

choices.D: It succeeds and exports the full database, simultaneously creating three dump files at three different locations, but the total number of dump files can exceed
choices.B: It fails because no absolute path is specified for the log file and dump file.
choices.C: It succeeds and exports the full database, simultaneously creating three copies of dump files at three different locations.
choices.A: It fails because the log file parameter is not specified.

questions.question_text:
You notice that the performance of your production 24x7 Oracle 12c database has significantly degraded. Sometimes, you are not able to connect to the database instance because it hangs.
How can you detect the cause of the degraded performance?

choices.D: by running ADDM in diagnostic mode
choices.C: by using Active Session History (ASH) data and performing hang analysis
choices.B: by running ADDM to fetch information from the latest Automatic Workload Repository (AWR) snapshots
choices.A: by performing emergency monitoring using Real-Time Automatic Database Diagnostic Monitor (ADDM) to fetch data directly from SGA for analysis

questions.question_text:
Automatic Shared Memory Management (ASMm) is enabled for your database instance, but parameters for the managed components are not defined.
You execute this command:
SQL> ALTER SYSTEM SET DB_CACHE_SIZE = 100M;
Which statement is true?

choices.C: The minimum space guaranteed in the buffer cache for any server process is 100 MB.
choices.B: The maximum size for the standard buffer cache is 100 MB.
choices.D: The maximum space in the buffer cache that can be released for dynamic distribution is 100 MB.
choices.E: The minimum size for all buffer caches is 100 MB.
choices.A: The minimum size for the standard buffer cache is 100 MB.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true regarding the Oracle Data Pump export and import operations?

choices.C: You can overwrite existing dump files during export.
choices.A: You cannot export data from a remote database.
choices.B: You can rename tables during import.
choices.D: You can compress data but not metadata during export.
